metadata.othernotes:
- IMPORTANT FOR LINES TARGETING HER CLOTHING: Currently, Kyoko has no alternative costumes, but she is slated to have some in the future and the "costume" marker will indicate which costume she is using.
- Her default (Danganronpa 1) costume has a value of 0, so lines targeting Kyoko with the conditions Not Said Marker "costume" or Said Marker "costume" value="0" will only target her default costume in the future.
- Slated for possible development are values of the costume marker "FF" (her suit from The Day Before the Future) and "swimsuit" (from Danganronpa S, for the summer event).
- Slated to have a butt pose named rear (#-rear.png), butt it's not implemented yet.

- Kyoko is a detective and tagged as such— she is registered in the Detective Library and part of a family lineage famous detectives, in fact— but doesn't say it outright during the game without being prompted by a target (except for one Game Over: Victory line). If another character starts to question relevant things or identifies her as a detective, she will talk about being one openly. There are two markers relevant to this:
- detectiveReveal indicates that Kyoko has revealed to the player that she is a detective.
- careerMention is a numerically-incremented marker counting the number of times Kyoko has alluded to her detective career. This includes things like not visiting bars outside work and owning a UV light.

- Kyoko is quiet. In her source material, she speaks only when she thinks it’s necessary and sometimes keeps silent for dozens of minutes at a time. In SPNATI, she has many lines (especially while forfeiting) where she only has internal dialogue or says nothing, and her sentences are very often short. She is firmly- but evenly-spoken.

- Kyoko is stoic, but by no means emotionless. As a lifestyle, she deliberately hides her emotions or expresses them in a blunt or subtle way so she can’t be easily taken advantage of. She isn’t as good at hiding her emotions during the forfeit.

- She avoids vulgar language and never uses interjections (other than “hmm” and the like).

- She is also unlikely to volunteer information about herself unprompted. I, her author, strongly encourage characters asking certain things about her, as she’s far more likely to talk about herself if someone’s asking.

- KYOKO IS ATTENTIVE and extremely observant. She picks up on the smallest details and personal tics right away. Her deductive reasoning skills are very strong as well; she almost always draws a correct conclusion based on what she sees. This is her main defining trait.

- Despite her stoicism, she is easygoing. She can take more in stride than the average person, and in SPNATI, she is generally relaxed and in very good spirits by her standards, mostly just trying to have fun with the game. SPNATI is a chance to truly relax that she just doesn’t have in her own source material. Ironically, she’s more likely to fret over something minor (like being asked about what magazines she likes) than anything morbid or life-threatening.

- She is interested in winning, but she doesn’t take the game super-seriously (though sometimes she jokingly pretends to).

- On that note, she is not the slightest bit embarrassed about stripping or showing her body and is fully prepared to strip and do the forfeit. Her composure is virtually untouched even when she’s fully nude or has finished doing the forfeit in front of everyone.

- She has a dry sense of humor. It comes out a bit more during the strip poker game than usual.

- Kyoko gets along well with people who express their emotions outwardly and even with, to some extent, ditzy people. In fact, she even appreciates emotional honesty, despite her own behavior.
- If someone is truly dim-witted in such a way that they jump to unfounded conclusions, however, Kyoko can get truly annoyed.

- Despite appearances, Kyoko likes cute things and traditionally feminine aesthetics, particularly flowers such as roses and cherry blossoms. She takes no shame in this; rather, she is insulted by the notion that this is strange for her.

- Though Kyoko is open and unashamed about her body, her hands are the exception. She is sensitive about them and is not at all willing to talk about why she wears her gloves or take her gloves off at any point.

- She has about no experience with magic or the supernatural (other than a self-proclaimed clairvoyant with little credibility as such) in her source material, with one major exception. She claims she can “hear the footsteps of the god of death as he moves” and has some apparent ability to sense when someone is going to die or attempt to kill another person. Characters with a supernatural connection to death, the afterlife, or the undead might be sensed by her.


- Sexually, Kyoko is a bit pent-up. A few rounds into her forfeit, she becomes prone to more obvious and far lewder thoughts (and sometimes remarks) than usual, to the point of completely covering her mouth in heavy masturbation to try and hide her emotions. She may show visible evidence of physical arousal while nude pre-forfeit, which she makes few comments on.

- Kyoko starts the game bi-curious but can have a bisexual awakening if she plays with other women. The entire game, she is open to this, and acknowledges her thoughts of attraction towards other women with very little resistance; she has wondered about it before the game as well.

- Kyoko has a type towards men: short and skinny with a small penis. The last detail is something she feels particular elation to seeing, and she could experience friction with particularly caustic SPH characters. She is still interested in men outside of this archetype. When it comes to women, she’s not as sure yet.

- Overall, Kyoko is inclusive with whom she plays with, expressing a non-sexual interest in even gay men and straight women. She may pay them compliments without intent to advance on them and ask gay men about male experiences.


- Birthday: October 6, 199X.
- Likes: Hair braids, coffee, chocolate, cereal.
- Dislikes: Goya fruit, cilantro, instant ramen, gambling for money.
- Blood type is B, weight is 48 kg (106 lbs), chest measurement is 82 cm (32”) around.
- Japanese name kanji: 霧切 響子 (Kirigiri Kyouko). Copy+paste into text editor or browser to view characters if they don't render in the CE.

case.name: The gloves stay on
case.description: Kyoko mentions that she has no intention to take her gloves off.

case.name: Panty peek
case.description: Kyoko's underwear is barely visible in her Stage 3 and 4 After Stripping poses; it's hard to notice, but an especially observant or perverted character might catch it. (Use Stripped (Minor, Female) for responding to stage 4 or Opponent Stripped for responding to either stage 3 or 4.)

case.name: Jacket and jill
case.description: Kyoko prepares for the forfeit by laying her jacket on the floor.

case.name: Kirigiri’s heavy forfeit
case.description: Throughout heavy masturbation, Kyoko covers her mouth. She also stops speaking completely until climax.

case.name: Amiss francs
case.description: Kyoko claims her jacket cost her 900 Swiss francs. Isn't she Japanese? What's up with that?

case.name: Pokémon Trainers
case.description: When playing with three Pokémon Trainers, Kyoko may start a line of questioning about Pokémon (her world is far more mundane than the Pokémon world).

case.name: Mardi Gras
case.description: On a Tuesday February 3 to March 9, Kyoko may ask a female target with the "American" tag exposing her chest about toplessness at Mardi Gras. Of course, she could easily be asking the completely wrong woman.

case.name: Santa Hat Story
case.description: For the Christmas Event: Kyoko shares a highly specific and outlandish story about a Santa Claus hat if an opponent takes one off. In following lines, she asks the others if they believe her.

case.name: Drenched Detective
case.description: The operative marker here is arousalVisible -- In her Naked stage (8), Kyoko can be visibly wet upon stripping, or become such at ANY point in the stage. (It’s really hard for players to see this right now, though.)

notes.note: This was the first line of dialogue ever written for Kyoko!
I wrote this line the first time I got high. I don't consider it high-quality enough to include in any capacity other than as April Fool's-only dialogue.
In-joke from the SPNATI community Discord. I, Kiki Retzorg, used a screenshot of this line as a way to announce having hit 401 lines, but the line was a little more popular than I anticipated.
This is also an Othello reference, just not as transparent of one as the "outflanked" line.

I spent way too long trying to find the proper Japanese word what Kyouko won't be easily. It's "hasamu," and it refers to capturing pieces in Othello. So, important note if anyone wants to translate this game into Japanese, I guess?
"I can hear them, you know. The footsteps of the god of death. … I can hear the god of death as he moves." --Kyoko Kirigiri, Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc, Chapter 5
"I can hear them, you know. The footsteps of the god of death. … I can hear the god of death as he moves." --Kyoko Kirigiri, Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc, Chapter 5
"I can hear them, you know. The footsteps of the god of death. … I can hear the god of death as he moves." --Kyoko Kirigiri, Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc, Chapter 5
This case is intended as a failsafe if something unusual (such as an opponent finishing) causes a moved-hair pose to be used when Kyoko hasn't moved her hair the normal way.
The line here mentioning how long it's been since she last wore her outfit was the 1,000th line written for Kyoko on December 8, 2022.
This will be expanded (hehe) into a sequence later on and be given its natural priority but for now I am leaving this as-is
This case is intended as a failsafe if something unusual (such as an opponent finishing) causes a moved-hair pose to be used when Kyoko hasn't moved her hair the normal way.
Meaning "Better luck next time." Special thanks to someone who wished to be identified as "Some German Tattergreis" for translating these German lines!
Meaning "Right, right, you're bloody well right." Special thanks to someone who wished to be identified as "Some German Tattergreis" for translating these German lines!
Meaning "You got this." Special thanks to someone who wished to be identified as "Some German Tattergreis" for translating these German lines!
Meaning the same thing as "Auf Wiedersehen" (see you later), only typically used over the phone and denoting "Until I hear your voice again."

Included at the request of Some German Tattergreis; a line from Joseph Joestar in the German dub of JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Stardust Crusaders. "I solve my problems with skill and grace, and now you're getting smacked in the face."

Genuine apologies if you're a foot fetishist here; this is a writing decision based on Kyoko's canon, not my, the writer's, personal attitude towards the kink. She used to be a lot cooler about people being into feet, but then I read Danganronpa Kirigiri Volume 4 and found a description of a 13-year-old Kyoko being asked by adult strangers to take her shoes off for an investigation and her being notably uncomfortable with it. Kitayama Takekuni actually wrote that and made that canon in the Danganronpa universe, because while he is a genius, he is also terrible.

label.label: CD and Kyoko annihilate the 4th wall

markers.marker: "Always ready, I see" and other versions of the line

"I didn't take you for the type to put sharp blades near their most delicate parts."

Set to "hi", "lo", or "no" during her bluffing phase (game rounds 8-11) depending on how she's bluffing in this current hand.

Lost X hands while bluffing=lo
Lost X hands while bluffing=no
Won X hands while bluffing=hi
Won X hands while bluffing=lo
Won X hands while bluffing=no

kirigiri_underwear collectible is unlocked
She has given express verbal consent to a character looking at her while they masturbate.
"There's no reason to feel guilty about glancing at my body."
Marker indicating her costume using strings. 0 = default; FF = Future Foundation costume; swimsuit = Danganronpa S swimsuit costume.
"It really is quite cute." "What? I'm allowed to like cute things." (=3 if triggered by male opponent)
She has stated outright or otherwise confirmed that she is a detective.
X times, she has said something in the German language
"No human language can describe the disappointment I'm feeling right now."
Line indicating she knows the human's forfeit timer is 1 (clears if human doesn't finish next screen)
Automatically counts lines that are just ellipsis, lacking any letters that a word could be made out of. Decrements by 1 each strip phase.
Stripped important, tag=ENF/ENM, lines referencing ~target~ covering up with their hands.
"I see now I should've kept my shoes on longer" and other versions of the line
She's explained early in the game that masturbation is a penalty for losing.
Used while Kyoko is wearing the Future Foundation outfit.
The giddy pose has appeared X times this game. Counted with hidden lines.
She has said she won't take her gloves off this game.
Activates if she has moved her hair out of the way of her chest at stage 8 (naked). Should activate automatically if she uses any pose other than the strips or aside2 during stage 8.
"Just a second. I have to untie this."

"Already completely exposed yourself, yet you still have layers to spare?" (to human)

Only the human player and Kyoko Kirigiri remain in the game, and both have lost all layers.
"I'm surprised it's taking you so long. After all, you're a man."
"..." in response to a villain being ahead of her with two pair or better.

"They act cold, but I suspect they're nobler than they let on.""
"I'm glad Celeste isn't here tonight."
Kyoko swaps no cards for the hand. Values 1-4 depend on line said.
Kyoko says she is taking notes as a male character masturbates.
Kyoko has noticed Alter Ego, Chihiro Fujisaki's AI, on the ground before he introduced himself.
Kyoko has not become the first player to forfeit this game.

"Stand back unless you feel like being in the splash zone.

Despite being Japanese, she says her jacket cost 90 Swiss francs.
"Word of advice...try rubbing your thighs together."
"A classmate in high school once told me this tie completes my outfit."

pendingLines.line: There’s still one question that bugs me, though. If you really are a guy, why did you hide that in the first place?
